result.execSummary:
The defendant Tamia Laione Bearder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Shall serve 20 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 7/18/22
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges
Shall serve 20 hours uncompensated Community Service, bringing proof to 7/18 Hearing
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

3:15 PM Defendant Tamia Laione Bearder in court. Court holds discussion with defendant regarding 20 hours of community service that was to be completed by today. Defendant heard; submits paperwork to court. Community service hours not completed. Court orders defendants to report to jail immediately. Defendant to walk over to jail on her own.
Post-judgment hearing on July 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
